headline: Stocks Rose Last Week After Supreme Court Tossed Tariffs
summary: U.S. stocks ended the week on a high note after the Supreme Court threw out President Trump’s sweeping tariffs.    The S&P 500 advanced 1.1% for the week, and the Dow industrials added 0.3%.   The Nasdaq composite rose 1.

content.title: Stocks Rose Last Week After Supreme Court Tossed Tariffs
content.summary: U.S. stocks ended the week on a high note after the Supreme Court threw out President Trump’s sweeping tariffs.    The S&P 500 advanced 1.1% for the week, and the Dow industrials added 0.3%.   The Nasdaq composite rose 1.

headline: Australian Motoring Service Adds Support for Apple's Roadside Assistance via Satellite through Infobip
summary: Global cloud communication platform Infobip supports Apple's Roadside Assistance via satellite feature through Australian Motoring Service (AMS).* The groundbreaking technology enables drivers with iPhone 14 or later to request help and text with AMS — even in areas without cellular coverage — marking a significant advancement in automotive safety and customer service in Australia.

content.title: Australian Motoring Service Adds Support for Apple's Roadside Assistance via Satellite through Infobip
content.summary: Global cloud communication platform Infobip supports Apple's Roadside Assistance via satellite feature through Australian Motoring Service (AMS).* The groundbreaking technology enables drivers with iPhone 14 or later to request help and text with AMS — even in areas without cellular coverage — marking a significant advancement in automotive safety and customer service in Australia.

headline: Omdia: Apple and HONOR Claim Record Market Shares as Europe’s Smartphone Shipment Dips 1% in 2025
summary: LONDON, February 23, 2026--The latest research from Omdia reveals that the European smartphone market declined by 1% in 2025 to 134.2 million units, marking the end of a disruptive year defined by subdued demand and new regulations requiring eco-design and USB-C.

headline: Apple’s Stock Recovery Is No Recovery At All

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Bets on the New York Times. Buffett Wins Again.
summary: Warren Buffett has long been a fan of newspapers, so much so that  Apple  even developed a paper-tossing game as an app for the iPhone for a  Berkshire Hathaway  shareholder meeting a few years ago.  Berkshire recently disclosed a new stake in  New York Times  , the publishing company that is thriving in the midst of the traditional-media downturn.  The Oracle of Omaha’s conglomerate said that it had acquired a little more than five million shares of New York Times stock in the fourth quarter.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway Bets on the New York Times. Buffett Wins Again.
content.summary: Warren Buffett has long been a fan of newspapers, so much so that  Apple  even developed a paper-tossing game as an app for the iPhone for a  Berkshire Hathaway  shareholder meeting a few years ago.  Berkshire recently disclosed a new stake in  New York Times  , the publishing company that is thriving in the midst of the traditional-media downturn.  The Oracle of Omaha’s conglomerate said that it had acquired a little more than five million shares of New York Times stock in the fourth quarter.

headline: Alphabet Sits At Center Of AI And Robotaxi Shifts
summary: Alphabet (NasdaqGS:GOOGL) has reportedly reached an agreement for Apple to use its Gemini AI model in the next version of Siri. The arrangement would involve Apple paying Alphabet to power some Siri features with Gemini. Separately, Alphabet’s Waymo unit clarified that its robotaxis are never remotely driven and that remote staff only provide high level guidance. Waymo’s clarification is aimed at regulators and the public as scrutiny of autonomous vehicle safety and oversight continues. For...

Waymo’s clarification is aimed at regulators and the public as scrutiny of autonomous vehicle safety and oversight continues. For...
